int rt_request_global_irq (unsigned int irq, void(*handler)(void))

Function Documentation

int rt_free_global_irq (  unsigned int  irq  ) 
 

Uninstall IT service routine.

rt_free_global_irq uninstalls the interrupt service routine, resetting it for Linux if it was previously owned by the kernel.

Return values:
0 on success.
EINVAL if irq is not a valid IRQ number.

int rt_request_global_irq (  unsigned int  irq,
void(*  handler)(void)
) 
 

Install IT service routine.

rt_request_global_irq installs function handler as a real time interrupt service routine for IRQ level irq, eventually stealing it to Linux.

Parameters:
handler is then invoked whenever interrupt number irq occurs. The installed handler must take care of properly activating any Linux handler using the same irq number it stole, by calling rt_pend_linux_irqr().
Return values:
0 on success.
EINVAL if irq is not a valid IRQ number or handler is NULL.
EBUSY if there is already a handler of interrupt irq.
